channel.title: 64-Bit Issue
channel.description: Hello there, I released a 317 server recently. But a few (small amount) of players have some issue, which may be linked to there 64-bit computer. They can log in and everything, but there client just crashed at random points. Ive had them install there java for windows 64-bit if they haven't, but that didn't work. Any suggestions are highly appreciated.

item.title: 64-Bit Issue
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“WhyPlayLegit, post:6, topic:343352”]They get an error stating

Cannot find main class: Gui

@echo off cd Client "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx400m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32 pause

Read full topic

item.title: 64-Bit Issue
item.dc:creator: @WhyPlayLegit WhyPlayLegit
item.description:
@WhyPlayLegit wrote:

They get an error stating

Cannot find main class: Gui

Read full topic

item.title: 64-Bit Issue
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“WhyPlayLegit, post:4, topic:343352”]Hm. Well this is my run.bat

[code]I dont think my run.bat has that kind of classpath

@echo off Title Why Play Legit cd Client Start JAVAW -Xmx400m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32 exit[/code]

I dont know how to set a class path on here for Program files (x86).[/quote]

Try:

@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx400m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32 pause

Read full topic

item.title: 64-Bit Issue
item.dc:creator: @WhyPlayLegit WhyPlayLegit
item.description:
@WhyPlayLegit wrote:

Hm. Well this is my run.bat

@echo off Title Why Play Legit cd Client Start JAVAW -Xmx400m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32 exit

I dont know how to set a class path on here for Program files (x86).

Read full topic

item.title: 64-Bit Issue
item.dc:creator: @spy_man47 spy man47
item.description:
@spy_man47 wrote:

Yh, just create an extra batch file…

Read full topic

item.title: 64-Bit Issue
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

You need to create an extra batch file to run the client, that will direct to their 64-bit Java instead of their 32-bit Java.

Instead of going in “Program Files”, you’ll need to go into “Program Files (x86)”.

Read full topic
